DataElement.preferredName: Renal Cell Carcinoma Associated with Xp11.2 Translocations/TFE3 Gene Fusions Histologic Classification Data Unknown Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A single character text field to record information related to a histologic classification of renal cell carcinoma associated with Xp11.2 translocations/TFE3 gene fusions.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Renal Cell Carcinoma Associated with Xp11.2 Translocations/TFE3 Gene Fusions Histologic Classification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A group of renal cell carcinomas characterized by the presence of different translocations involving the chromosome Xp11.2. These translocations result in the creation of gene fusions involving the TFE3 gene. Patients are usually children and young adults. Morphologically, the malignant epithelial cells form papillary patterns._Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Renal Cell Carcinoma Associated with Xp11.2 Translocations/TFE3 Gene Fusions
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A group of renal cell carcinomas characterized by the presence of different translocations involving the chromosome Xp11.2. These translocations result in the creation of gene fusions involving the TFE3 gene. Patients are usually children and young adults. Morphologically, the malignant epithelial cells form papillary patterns.

Concepts.definition: A group of renal cell carcinomas characterized by the presence of different translocations involving the chromosome Xp11.2. These translocations result in the creation of gene fusions involving the TFE3 gene. Patients are usually children and young adults. Morphologically, the malignant epithelial cells form papillary patterns.

Property.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to histology.:Classification; the grouping of things into classes or categories.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.
A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
